name: The Lodge at Jackson Hole

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very surprised at how nice this hotel is, and we would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: SURPRISINGLY NICE

reviews.text: I have mixed feelings regarding this hotel. My family and I stayed there for three nights in June 2012, during our 11 day trip to Yellowstone, the Grand Teton, and a few other places.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.text: On the PLUS side:
reviews.title: Just about perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The breakfast buffet was fabulous. Great selection (eggs, potatoes, cereals, pastries, muffins, yogurt,...) and plenty of fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Nothing but dissapointment

reviews.text: 2. There is an awesome indoor/outdoor pool, with 2 hot tubs, and very comfortable couches and chairs. My kids loved the pool!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but expensive & not a great location

reviews.text: We recently stayed 3 nights here in June and had a nice stay. The whole hotel was recently renovated and the rooms had a nice upscale lodge-y feel to them. The size of the rooms was not huge but the quality was nice. We had a king bed and I believe all rooms have pullout sofabeds in them. The desk was nice and brought us extra blankets for the sofabed since none were in the room. The hotel is located just outside of downtown Jackson, just a few minutes' drive and we never had trouble parking downtown. At the hotel, the front parking spaces usually filled up but we found space in the back, which wasn't a big deal. The breakfast included coffee, tea, juice, scrambled eggs (with meat and without), bland diced breakfast potatoes, fruit, toast/bagels, yogurt, cereals, oatmeal. The breakfast area was usually busy and crowded in the morning. The shower was huge and had a neat rotating head. We had 3 people in the room and, even though we clearly used the shampoo/conditioner, housekeeping did not replace them, which was pretty annoying at this price point. This hotel was not cheap whatsoever, but it seems all the Jackson hotels are pretty pricey. The pool was on the warm side and there's an indoor and outdoor hot tub, except when we were there, the outdoor one was cold(?). The hotel also has a laundry room. They claim to have a fitness room, but we couldn't find it, even though the property is small. 3 free computers also provided, which was convenient for checking in for flights. Hotel is about a 20-minute drive to the airport.
reviews.title: Nice stay at cute property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great sized room. comfortable bed. Hubby loved the giant flat screened tv. Fantastic bathroom. Lovely to have a nice settee to sit on. Only had breakfast one of the mornings we stayed this was fine as previously mentioned lots of eggs!!
reviews.title: spacious mini suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the pool area. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a 'mini-suite with jacuzzi' for a bit of luxury after a week camping in Yellowstone, only to be told that the hotel had been 'redeveloped' and there were no such rooms. No apology or refund however. The 'free' breakfast was extremely crowded and fairly poor.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: The pool complex was very nice.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL
WOW! WOW!
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Best Western Plus - The Lodge and absolutely loved our stay. We were sad to leave.

reviews.title: Beautiful facility, a few glitches
reviews.text: Pros...
* Newly remodeled rooms ( plush bed, large bathrooms, clean, flat screen tvs)
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: * Large swimming pool
reviews.title: Rustic with all the Goodies!!

reviews.text: * Cute interior with nice details
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: this hotel was recently renovated - great job! We made this hotel as our home place to travel to Jackson Hole, Tetons, and yellowstone. very nice place- real homie.
reviews.title: what a trip

reviews.text: Close to all the areas we visited
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel twice now. Once before they renovated and the second time after. This hotel is clean and provides a wonderful place to stay when visiting the area. We will be back..
reviews.title: Rooms and service great but free breakfast a bust!!

reviews.text: Absolutely loved the lodge and our room but the free breakfast was a wash-out:
reviews.title: Great Base for Jackson Hole

reviews.text: 1. Room for breakfast was too small and not enough tables to seat the hugh bus loads of tourist that are brought in to stay at the lodge. Two of our children had to fight the crowd to get food and then had to take it to their room to eat. One skipped all together because was packed with people falling over each other. Lodge was full each night we stayed there.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

aka: Best Western Plus The Lodge At Jackson Hole Hotel
description: The Lodge at Jackson Hole unveiled a complete renovation in the Fall of 2012. Come experience the area's newest and most luxurious accommodations offering generous amenities, stylish rustic decor and unsurpassed comfort. Each mini suite beckons guests to unwind with presidential double pillow top mattresses dressed with plush linens and accents and a spacious sitting area outfitted with a queen sleeper sofa. The spacious bathroom features granite countertops, double vanity and Molton Brown bath products. After a day of outdoor adventure in Jackson Hole, we invite you to relax and experience the best in technology with a 52" LCD LED 3D television and Blu-ray player, iHome alarm clock and a large desk with a built-in electronic hub, ideal for recreational and business travelers alike. Hotel amenities include a new lounge & patio serving innovative cocktails and family friendly cuisine, a newly designed indoor/outdoor pool, hot tub and sauna, and a state-of-the art fitness center. The Lodge offers a complimentary gourmet buffet breakfast to guests each morning. Make use of the courtesy car (upon availability 7am-11pm)or the free local town shuttle that makes regular stops out front for quick trips into town. Dining and shopping galore are located nearby. The Lodge at Jackson Hole is centrally located near Grand Teton & Yellowstone National Parks, Jackson Hole Mountain Resort and the great Snake River. Nearby recreational activities include fishing, whitewater rafting, hunting, sightseeing, hiking, biking, skiing, snowmobiling and horseback riding. Relax in luxurious accommodations after an exciting day of exploring beautiful Jackson at the Lodge at Jackson Hole!
